story:
Once upon a time in a small village, there lived a young Jewish boy named David. David was known throughout the village for his kindness and caring nature towards others. Every day, he would help his neighbors with their chores and always had a smile on his face.

One night, as David was getting ready for bed, he heard a soft rustling outside his window. Curious, he peeked outside and saw a small injured bird lying on the ground. Without hesitation, David gently picked up the bird and brought it inside.

He carefully tended to the bird's wounds, wrapping them in soft cloth and giving it some seeds to eat. As the night went on, the bird's health improved, and it chirped happily, perched on David's hand.

David watched in amazement as the bird spread its wings and flew around the room before landing back on his shoulder. The bird's feathers shimmered in the moonlight, and David felt a warm sense of peace wash over him.

"Thank you, David, for your kindness and compassion," the bird chirped softly before flying off into the night sky.

From that day on, David knew the importance of helping others in need, no matter how small they may be. And he always remembered the lesson of the injured bird, carrying its message of love and kindness in his heart forever.

And so, as David drifted off to sleep, he felt grateful for the little bird's visit and the wisdom it had brought. With a smile on his face, he closed his eyes, knowing that he had made a difference in the world, one act of kindness at a time.

Goodnight, sweet child, and remember the power of kindness and compassion in all that you do. Sleep well, for tomorrow is a new day filled with opportunities to spread love and joy to those around you. Sweet dreams, my dear child.
